an10.117:4.1: Then Saṅgārava the brahmin went up to the Buddha,
an10.117:4.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
an10.117:4.5: “Master Gotama, what is the near shore? And what is the far shore?”
an10.117:4.6: “Wrong view is the near shore, brahmin, and right view is the far shore.
an10.117:4.7: Wrong motivation is the near shore, and right motivation is the far shore.
an10.117:4.8: Wrong speech is the near shore, and right speech is the far shore.
an10.117:4.9: Wrong action is the near shore, and right action is the far shore.
an10.117:4.10: Wrong livelihood is the near shore, and right livelihood is the far shore.
an10.117:4.11: Wrong effort is the near shore, and right effort is the far shore.
an10.117:4.12: Wrong mindfulness is the near shore, and right mindfulness is the far shore.
an10.117:4.13: Wrong samādhi is the near shore, and right samādhi is the far shore.
an10.117:4.14: Wrong knowledge is the near shore, and right knowledge is the far shore.
an10.117:4.15: Wrong freedom is the near shore, and right freedom is the far shore.
an10.117:4.16: This is the near shore, and this is the far shore.”
an10.117:5.2: who cross to the far shore.
an10.117:6.1: When the teaching is well explained,
an10.117:6.3: are the ones who will cross over
an10.117:6.4: the realm of death so very hard to cross.
an10.117:7.2: an astute person should develop the bright.
an10.117:7.4: for the seclusion so hard to enjoy,
an10.117:8.1: you should try to find delight there,
an10.117:8.3: With no possessions, an astute person
an10.117:8.4: should cleanse themselves of mental corruptions.
an10.117:9.1: And those whose minds are rightly developed
an10.117:9.6: they are extinguished in this world.”
